definition: to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: You are directed to step inside the elevator and the doors close.
sentences.chinese: 他们引着你步入这部电梯，电梯门合上了。

sentences.english: She conducted us into a cottage.
sentences.chinese: 她引着我们走进一所茅舍。

sentences.english: She guided the tourists around the city.
sentences.chinese: 她引着旅游者参观了这个城市。

sentences.english: The sparks kindled the dry grass.
sentences.chinese: 有些火星把干草给引着了。

sentences.english: A bright river jumped out streaming along the road.
sentences.chinese: 窗外突然跳出来的一条明亮的河水带引着我们前行。

sentences.english: He leads the waitress step-by-step to his original goal.
sentences.chinese: 他引着女服务生一步一步地达到他的初始目标。

sentences.english: In effect, the students are guided along the decision-making process.
sentences.chinese: 其结果是学生被玻拉斯的决策过程引着走。

sentences.english: Yesterday afternoon was Li Ming led the blind man to cross the road .
sentences.chinese: 昨天下午是李明引着那位盲人过路的。

sentences.english: They instruct you to go behind the screen and change into the provided attire.
sentences.chinese: 他们引着你去到屏风后换上这同样的装扮。

sentences.english: He guiding us, we had no trouble in finding his house.
sentences.chinese: 他引着我们，我们毫不费劲就找到了他的家。

sentences.english: What we eat daily plays a significant role in the health of our skin as well.
sentences.chinese: 我们每天吃的食物对于皮肤健康也引着重要作用。

sentences.english: Gradually, he led the wind-deer into the curtained-off pathway.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢地，他引着风鹿进入用帘子隔开的通道。

definition: one after the other/in single file

combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书[liu4 shu1] of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds/to comprehend without being told explicitly/to cotton on/knowing (smile, glance etc)
to lead the way/to guide/to show the way/fig. to instruct
to walk in in a line
